attributes.action: Form a Government of National Unity.
attributes.additional_details:
In the campaign leading up to the recent referendum, politicians of all parties and other leaders stood side by side to argue their case. 
Leadership and unity of both Labour and Conservative parties has been significantly absent during the campaign leading to a result which is approximately supported by 1/3 of the population, rejected by 1/3 and ignored by 1/3 who failed to vote.
A National Government would mobilise the best leadership in the UK to ensure the best possible outcome for the future.
attributes.background: To best manage the UK's decision to leave the EU a National Government is called for which encompasses all political parties. No single party is currently able to represent the best interests of all members of the population in developing the most satisfactory outcome for all citizens of the UK.
